content.description: Follows the obvious (and very difficult looking) dihedral. Climb through a series of ledges that can be protected with cams to the first bolt. Some hard stemming will through a pin and another bolt. There are gear placements that will help get you through the roof and to the last bolt. Hard and very fun if you like smeary dihedrals
Corner crack to the right of Serpentine. Fun and well protected with a mildly run out ending. no anchor.
content.protection: All gear, bring an assortment of cams and nuts.

content.description: start up the hand crack flake for 15' to the top of the pedestal.  Pro up and launch into the finger crack.  Crack is thin tips with pods you can get a full pad on.  Climbs trends up and right with the crux in the middle.  Crank through with a green alien and start sidepulling up to the finger locks.
content.protection: a couple green aliens, yellow alien, maybe some nuts and 1 adn 2 cams for the anchor
content.location: 200' south of the hidden wall on the next wall.

content.description: Scramble up the base of Hidden Wall to the left of Serpentine to the base of a diagonal (left to right) crack. Climb through a small facy section before reaching the crack. Climb up and right in the gorgeous hand crack with smeary feet until you reach a vertical finger crack. climb the finger crack to straight up and over the lip to a good crack for your anchor. (bring gear for anchor)
Located in between Lost Dome and Crab Eyes. West facing crag and is visible from Lost Dome.
